body_html:
Yes, I have the same problem as @lorenzoriano . I am returning a tf.data.Dataset.from_tensor_slices and get the error message at the top of this thread. Any suggestions on how I can fix this without rewriting to not use tf.Tensor which would feel like a backward step.

Later...
I seem to have solved my issue by making the batch_size when getting data for .predict 1 rather than None as shown in my changed to default settings in my input_fn.

def input_fn(features, labels=None, batch_size=None, shuffle=False, num_epochs=1):  # caused error  
def input_fn(features, labels=None, batch_size=1, shuffle=False, num_epochs=1):   # works

I couldn't find any description of this in the tensorflow documentation but I guessed it was the same as step in .evaluate where None or -1 can make it iterate for ever.

Yes, I have the same problem as @lorenzoriano . I am returning a tf.data.Dataset.from_tensor_slices and get the error message at the top of this thread. Any suggestions on how I can fix this without rewriting to not use tf.Tensor which would feel like a backward step.

def input_fn(features, labels=None, batch_size=None, shuffle=False, num_epochs=1):  # caused error

I couldn't find any description of this in the tensorflow documentation but I guessed it was the same as step in .evaluate where None or -1 can make it iterate for ever.
body:
Yes, I have the same problem as @lorenzoriano . I am returning a tf.data.Dataset.from_tensor_slices and get the error message at the top of this thread. Any suggestions on how I can fix this without rewriting to not use tf.Tensor which would feel like a backward step.

Later...
I seem to have solved my issue by making the batch_size when getting data for .predict 1 rather than None as shown in my changed to default settings in my input_fn. 
```
def input_fn(features, labels=None, batch_size=None, shuffle=False, num_epochs=1):  # caused error  
def input_fn(features, labels=None, batch_size=1, shuffle=False, num_epochs=1):   # works
```
I couldn't find any description of this in the tensorflow documentation but I guessed it was the same as step in .evaluate where None or -1 can make it iterate for ever.
